DOC.brief_summary: This study include male subject age 45 70 , sustain traumatic Spinal Cord Injury ( SCI ) least 10 year prior . Subjects interview demographic data , include heart disease risk factor . A blood test cholesterol level draw . A CT scan artery heart perform determine presence coronary calcium , marker subclinical Coronary Heart Disease . Scoring Coronary Calcium Coronary Calcium Score ( CCS ) automate CT scanner . Each subject 's Framingham Risk Score calculate ; This individual 10 year risk Coronary Heart Disease event ( significant symptom ) . In addition , determined subject treat diagnosed dyslipidemia ( high cholesterol ) accord National Cholesterol Educational Program ( NCEP ) guideline . The propose pilot study aim well understand problem Coronary Heart Disease individual Spinal Cord Injury , specifically CCS SCI , compare general population .
DOC.brief_title: Coronary Heart Disease Measured Coronary Calcium Score Among Individuals With Chronic Traumatic Spinal Cord Injury
DOC.criteria: Male Spinal Cord Injury due externally inflicted trauma > = 10 year post injury American Spinal Injury Association ( ASIA ) Scale A , B , C 45 70 year age Communication comprehension sufficient compliance test procedure Voluntary inform consent Spinal Cord Injury nontraumatic etiology Injury < 10 year prior enrollment Known Coronary Heart Disease
